```{r setup}

knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.align = "center", fig.width = 8, fig.asp = 0.618)

library(tidyverse)
library(tidymodels)
#devtools::install_github("jtcies/jtcr")
library(jtcr)
library(irlba)

theme_set(theme_jtc())

rmse <- function(pred, actual) {

    resid <- pred - actual
    sqrt(mean(resid^2))
}

# download from my github for reproducibility
batting <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jtcies/phillies-task/master/batting.csv") %>%
   janitor::clean_names()

# bring in two additional data sets, both from fangraphs
# batted ball data from mar/apr 2018

batted_ball <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jtcies/phillies-task/master/batted-ball-2018.csv") %>%
    janitor::clean_names() %>%
    select(-name, -team, -babip) %>% 
    mutate_if(is.character, readr::parse_number) %>% 
    mutate_at(vars(ends_with("percent")), function(x) x / 100)

# and batting data from full 2017 season

batting_2017 <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jtcies/phillies-task/master/batting-2017.csv") %>%
    janitor::clean_names() %>%
    select(-name, -team, -ubr, -w_gdp, -w_rc_2) %>% 
    mutate_if(is.character, readr::parse_number) %>% 
    mutate_at(vars(ends_with("percent")), function(x) x / 100)
 
colnames(batting_2017) <- paste0(colnames(batting_2017), "_2017")

full_batting <- batting %>%
    left_join(batted_ball, by = "playerid") %>%
    left_join(batting_2017, by = c("playerid" = "playerid_2017"))

set.seed(2019)

train <- full_batting %>%
    sample_frac(0.8)

test <- full_batting %>%
    filter(!playerid %in% train$playerid)

```

```{r missing}

#sum(!complete.cases(train))
# not many missing so i will just take the mean

train_means <- train %>% 
    purrr::map_if(is.numerictra, function(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))

for (i in 1:ncol(train)) {
    
    train[, i] <- ifelse(is.na(train[, i]), train_means[[i]], train[, i])
    
}

```


## EDA

```{r eda}

train %>%
    ggplot(aes(full_season_avg)) +
        geom_histogram() 

## normally distributed

as_tibble(cor(train[, 4:29])) %>%
    mutate(var1 = colnames(train[, 4:29])) %>%
    gather(var2, cor, 1:26) %>%
    ggplot(aes(var1, var2, fill = cor)) +
        geom_tile() +
        scale_fill_gradient2() +
        theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))


train %>%
    ggplot(aes(mar_apr_avg, full_season_avg)) +
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
        geom_abline(color = "red") +
        geom_hline(yintercept = mean(train$mar_apr_avg), linetype = 3) +
        geom_vline(xintercept = mean(train$full_season_avg), linetype = 3)

# pretty serious regression to the mean

```

## PCA

```{r pca}

# https://juliasilge.com/blog/stack-overflow-pca/

avg_pca <- prcomp_irlba(train[, 4:28], n = 10, scale. = TRUE)

pca_tidy <- as_tibble(avg_pca$rotation) %>%
    mutate(var = colnames(train[, 4:28])) %>%
    gather(pc, contribution, -var)

pca_tidy %>%
    filter(pc == "PC2") %>%
    mutate(var = fct_reorder(var, contribution)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(var, contribution)) + 
        geom_col() +
        facet_wrap(~pc) +
        coord_flip() 

```

## model

```{r scale}

#https://tidymodels.github.io/parsnip/articles/articles/Regression.html

scaled <- train %>%
    select(4:29) %>%
    mutate_all(function(x) scale(x)[,1])
```

```{r rf}

rf <- rand_forest(mode = "regression", mtry = .preds(), trees = 1000) %>%
    set_engine("randomForest") %>%
    fit(full_season_avg ~ ., data = scaled) 

```

```{r lasso}

lasso <- linear_reg(penalty = 0.001) %>%
    set_engine("glmnet") %>%
    fit(full_season_avg ~ ., data = scaled)


```

## Evaluate precitions

```{r pred}

preds <- scaled %>%
    bind_cols(predict(rf, new_data = .) %>% rename(rf_pred = .pred)) %>%
    bind_cols(predict(lasso, new_data = .) %>% rename(lasso_pred = .pred))

c("rf_pred", "lasso_pred") %>% 
    set_names() %>%
    purrr::map(~ metrics(data = preds, truth = full_season_avg, estimate = .x)) 


preds %>%
    select(full_season_avg, rf_pred, lasso_pred) %>%
    gather(model, pred, 2:3) %>%
    ggplot(aes(pred, full_season_avg)) +
        geom_point() +
        facet_wrap(~ model) +
        geom_abline(color = "red", lty = 2)

```
